subject: Philosophy
title: Do We Have Free Will?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Do We Have Free Will?.

hook.text: You chose to read this. Or did your brain decide before you were even aware of it?

buildup.text: Free will is the belief that you could have done otherwise. That your choices are truly yours.

discovery.text: Determinism says every event is caused by prior events. Your choices were set at the Big Bang.

twist.text: Quantum physics adds randomness, but random isn't free either.

climax.text: Whether the universe is clockwork or chaos, neither seems to leave room for true freedom.

punchline.text: Free will might be our greatest illusion.

quiz.question: What does determinism claim about our choices?
options: They are caused by prior events
